description: Site of a Roman building uncovered in the 1930s, a wall foundation, tiles and tesserae were uncovered with coins dated from Hadrian to Allectus. Interpreted as a possible villa or temple owing to the presence of a nearby villa and its prominent position.
bibliography: “A Gazetteer of Roman Villas in Britain” 1 (1993): 91.
“Roman Britain in 1937,” Journal of Roman studies, 28 (1938): 185.
